2: For each two-way voice communication application that has real-time video, is there a visual indicator of spoken activity?

criterium.title: For each [two-way voice communication application](glossary.md#two-way-voice-communication-application), is a visual indicator of oral activity present?

norm: 6.2.2.4 Visual indicator of Audio with RTT
6.5.5 Visual indicator of audio with video

criterium.title: Does each [real-time text communication](glossary.md#real-time-text-communication) application that can interact with other [real-time text communication](glossary.md#real-time-text-communication) applications comply with the interoperability rules in force?

For each application that supports [real-time text (RTT) communication](glossary.md#real-time-text-communication), the transmission delay for each [input unit](glossary.md#input-unit) is 500ms or less. Is this rule respected?

1: For each telecommunication application that provides caller identification, does the identification meet these conditions?
The caller identification is presented in text form;
The caller identification is accessible to assistive technologies.

criterium.title: For each telecommunication application, is the identification of the party initiating a call accessible?

For each [two-way voice communication](glossary.md#two-way-voice-communication-application) application that provides caller identification, is there a way to present this identification for sign language users?

norm: 6.5.6 Speaker identification with video (sign language) communication

criterium.title: For each [two-way voice communication](glossary.md#two-way-voice-communication-application) application that has [voice-based services](glossary.md#voice-based-services), are these services usable without the need to listen or speak?

1: For each two-way voice communication application that has real-time video, are the following conditions met?
The video resolution is at least [QVGA](glossary.md#qvga);
The frame rate is at least 20 frames per second;
The lag between video and speech must not exceed 100ms.

criterium.title: For each [two-way voice communication application](glossary.md#two-way-voice-communication-application) that has real-time video, is the quality of the video sufficient?
